title: North Korea Confirms Detention of Travis King, U.S. Soldier
description: The statement was the first public acknowledgment by the country that it has the soldier, Pvt. Travis King, in its custody.

title: Russia’s Interest Rate Hike Highlights Economic Struggle Amid Ukraine War
description: With the third-largest interest rate increase in a decade to shore up the ruble, Moscow’s policymakers are pursuing the conflicting goals of paying for the war against Ukraine and taming inflation.

title: Can Koyo Kouoh Revive Zeitz MOCAA?
description: “There was a feeling that we cannot let this fail,” Koyo Kouoh said of taking the top job at Zeitz MOCAA. She wants to make it relevant to the Pan-African world and beyond.

title: At Least Three Dead After Russian Missile Attacks in Western Ukraine
description: Officials said more than two dozen missiles were fired in the strikes that were far from the front lines in the east and south.

title: In Greece, a ‘Beach Towel Movement’ Fights for a Spot on the Sand
description: As lounge chairs that rent for up to $130 pop up across the islands, local people have decided they won’t take it lying down.

title: U.K. Reveals 5 Espionage Arrests After BBC Reports Russia Link
description: Britain’s counterterrorism unit arrested the five on suspicion of spying on British intelligence, the authorities said following a BBC report that three of the same people had been accused of spying for Russia.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Russia Sharply Raises Interest Rates as Wartime Financial Problems Pile Up
description: The country’s central bank raised interest rates 3.5 percentage points to stem rising prices and a weakening ruble. The move came after the national currency briefly fell below a key level with the U.S. dollar.

title: Roaring Back From Pandemic, Japan’s Economy Grows at 6% Rate
description: The rapid expansion came as exports have risen and tourists have flooded the country. But a drop in domestic consumption worried economists.

title: Families of 17 USS Cole Sailors Killed by Al Qaeda Await Justice at Guantánamo Bay
description: Families of the sailors who were killed in the bombing of the U.S.S. Cole and survivors having been making the trek to the war court at Guantánamo Bay for pretrial hearings since 2011.

title: Typhoon Lan Brings Heavy Rain and Winds to Western Japan
description: The heavy rains and winds brought by the storm prompted evacuation warnings and the cancellation of hundreds of flights.

title: Dozens Said to Be Missing After Myanmar Jade Mine Landslide
description: The disaster occurred in Kachin State, where wildcat jade miners toil in dangerous conditions and landslides are common during the monsoon season.

title: The Hidden Trauma of Ukraine’s Soldiers
description: Facing a growing mental health crisis among soldiers, Ukraine’s therapists and doctors use a variety of treatments, but the need far outstrips the available care.

title: The Hidden Trauma of Ukraine’s Soldiers
description: Facing a growing mental health crisis among soldiers, Ukraine’s therapists and doctors use a variety of treatments, but the need far outstrips the available care.

title: The Ukrainian Mechanics Who Fix Tanks at the War’s Frontline
description: Behind the thousands of troops fighting the counteroffensive are engineers and technicians who perform an essential, and often dangerous, job.

title: Xuxa Was Brazil’s Barbie. Now She’s Saying Sorry.
description: Xuxa was once Brazil’s biggest TV star. Now many are wondering whether a thin, blond, white woman was the right idol for such a diverse country.

title: At Least 5 Dead in Blast at Gas Station in Russia’s Dagestan Region
description: Unconfirmed reports from a Russian news agency said the death toll from the explosion, whose cause was not yet known, could be 25 or more.
